topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: Allocating Object Servers

body.p: A Swift object server is a node that runs the swift-object service (only) and is used to store object data. It does not run the swift-proxy, swift-account or swift-container services.
This section describes the procedure to allocate Swift Object Server during the initial deployment of the system.

section.title: Procedure to allocate Swift Object Server
section.p:
Perform the following steps to allocate Swift Object Servers:
Verify if the example input model already contains a suitable server role. The server roles are usually described in data/server_roles.yml file. If the server role is not described, you must add a suitable server role as described in Creating Roles for Swift Nodes. While adding a server role for the Swift object server, you will also allocate drives to store object data as described in Allocating Disk Drives.
Verify if the example input model has a resource node assigned to Swift object servers. The resource nodes are usually assigned in data/control_plane.yml file. If it is not assigned, you must add a suitable resource node as described in Creating an Object Sever Resource nodes.

You add these details in the servers list (usually in data/servers.yml file).
As with all servers, you must also verify and/or modify the server-groups information (usually in data/server_groups.yml file) The only part of this process that is unique to Swift is the allocation of disk drives for use by the object ring as described in Allocating Disk Drives for use by Swift.
